intro: Lippia pringlei, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green foliage and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. Lippia pringlei is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking drought-tolerant plants.
